column2: Section 3 of the Evidence Ordinance provides interpretation to  the  said terms proved and not proved
a fact is said to be proved when, after considering the matters before it the court either
believes  it  to  exist  or  consider  its  existence  so  probable  that  a  prudent  man  ought,
under  the  circumstances  of the  particular  case,  to  act  upon  the  supposition  that  it
a fact is said not to be proved when it is  neither proved nor disproved
